title: Study on chemical composition, anti-pathogenic micro-organisms activity and inhibition activity against human breast cancer cell (MCF 7) of Juniperus sibirica essential oil
Abstract:
In recent years, due to the growing interest in natural products, plant essential oils have come more into the focus of phytomedicine [1,2]. Essential oils, one of the secondary metabolites in plants, are mixture of volatile organic compounds. They are used as food preservatives, additives, and natural remedies for food, cosmetic, pharmaceutical and agriculture sectors [2,3].In this study, we have investigated chemical characterization of needle essential oil from wild growing Juniperus sibirica in Mongolia and its antibacterial, antifungal and cytotoxic activities. In the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica needle, 78 compounds were identified. Among them α-pinene (48.6%), limonene + phellandrene (9.6%), myrtenyl acetate (4.03%), myrcene (3.3%) and β-pinene (3.0%) were identified as major constituents. This oil owned inhibitory activity against Bacillus. subtilis, Staphylococcus. aureus and Aspergillus. niger with 21, 17 and 11 mm clear zones. In addition, the oil at 50 μg/mL inhibited the growth of MCF-7 cell by 35.3% and at 100 μg/mL by 44.5%, respectively.The essential oil of Mongolian Juniperus sabina would be used as a preservative material in cosmetic and food products, as a bioactive agent in anti-inflammatory and wound healing products because of the determined antibacterial activity. In further, a detailed study on its anti-cancer and activity against pathogenic micro-organisms are necessary due to the promising anti-proliferative activity in breast cancer cell (MCF 7). 
Ямаан арц (Juniperus sibirica)-ны эфирийн тосны химийн бүрэлдэхүүн, бичил биетний эсрэг, хөхний хорт хавдрын (MCF 7) эсийн өсөлтийг дарангуйлах идэвхийн судалгаа 
Хураангуй: Сүүлийн жилүүдэд эфирийн тосны эрэлт ихсэж, тэдгээрийн хими, биологийн судалгаа эрчимтэй хийгдэх боллоо [1,2]. Эфирийн тос нь үнэртэн, гоо сайхан, шүдний эмчилгээ, хөдөө аж ахуйн бүтээгдэхүүн, ариутгагч бэлдмэл, хүнсний хадгалалтыг уртасгах, амт үнэр оруулах нэмэлт болон байгалийн гаралтай эмийн түүхий эдээр өргөн ашиглагддаг дэгдэмхий нэгдлүүдийн хольцоос тогтох ургамлын хоёрдогч метаболитуудын нэг юм [2,3].Бид энэхүү судалгаагаар Монголын ямаан арцны шилмүүсний эфирийн тосны химийн бүрэлдэхүүн, бичил биетний эсрэг, хөхний хорт хавдрын MCF 7 эсийг дарангуйлах идэвхийг тодорхойллоо. Ямаан арцны шилмүүсний эфирийн тосонд 78 бүрэлдэхүүн бодис илэрснээс -пинен-48.6%, лимонен+фелландрен-9.6%, миртенил ацетат-4.0%, β-пинен-3.0%, мирцен-3.6%, ∆3-карен- 3.4% зонхилон агуулагдаж байв. Энэ тосны бичил биетний эсрэг идэвхийг агар диффузын аргаар тодорхойлоход B.subtilis, S.aureus, A.niger бичил биетнүүдийн ургалтыг 21, 17, 11мм хүрээ үүсгэн дарангуйлсан бол MTT аргаар MCF-7 хөхний хорт хавдрын эсийн өсөлтийг дарангуйлах идэвхийг тодорхойлоход 50 мкг/мл тундаа 37.3%, 100 мкг /мл тундаа 44.5% дарангуйлав.Монголын ямаан арцны эфирийн тосыг түүний бичил биетний эсрэг идэвхэд үндэслэн гоо сайхан, хүнсний бүтээгдэхүүний хадгалалтыг уртасгах, идээт үрэвсэл, яр шархны эсрэг бэлдмэлийн биоидэвхт түүхий эдээр ашиглаж болох юм. Мөн хөхний хорт хавдрын эсийн өсөлтийг идэвхтэйгээр дарангуйлж байгаа учир цаашид ямаан арцны эфирийн тосны бичил биетний болон хавдрын эсрэг идэвхийн судалгааг нарийвчлан хийх нь зүйтэй. 
Түлхүүр үг: Juniperus sibirica, α-пинен, миртенил ацетат, B.subtilis, эфирийн тос .
Reason: The abstract explicitly mentions 'breast cancer' in relation to the MCF-7 cell line, which is a specific disease. The term 'breast cancer' is clearly stated as the disease context for the anti-proliferative activity of the essential oil. No other specific diseases are named.

α-pinene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract reports that the essential oil from Juniperus sibirica needles, which contains α-pinene as a major constituent (48.6%), exhibited inhibitory effects on the growth of MCF-7 breast cancer cells. Specifically, the oil inhibited MCF-7 cell growth by 35.3% at 50 μg/mL and 44.5% at 100 μg/mL concentrations. Although the study tested the whole essential oil rather than isolated α-pinene, the high proportion of α-pinene in the oil suggests it may contribute significantly to the observed anti-proliferative activity against breast cancer cells. Therefore, there is evidence of a relationship between α-pinene and breast cancer cell growth inhibition based on this study.

limonene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract describes the chemical composition and biological activities of essential oil from Juniperus sibirica, which contains limonene as part of a mixture (limonene + phellandrene at 9.6%). The essential oil showed inhibitory effects on breast cancer MCF-7 cell growth. However, the study does not isolate or specifically attribute the anti-cancer activity to limonene alone. The observed anti-proliferative effect is linked to the whole essential oil mixture, not to limonene individually. Therefore, there is no clear evidence from this abstract that limonene itself has a direct relationship with breast cancer.

phellandrene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract discusses the chemical composition of Juniperus sibirica essential oil, which includes a combined percentage of limonene and phellandrene (9.6%). The essential oil showed inhibitory effects on the growth of MCF-7 breast cancer cells. However, the study does not isolate or specifically attribute the anti-cancer activity to phellandrene alone. The activity is reported for the whole essential oil mixture, and phellandrene is mentioned only as part of a combined group with limonene. Therefore, there is no clear evidence in the abstract that directly links phellandrene individually to breast cancer activity.

myrtenyl acetate_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract reports that the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica, which contains 4.03% myrtenyl acetate among other compounds, shows inhibitory activity against breast cancer MCF-7 cells. However, the study evaluates the whole essential oil's effect rather than isolating the activity of myrtenyl acetate specifically. There is no direct evidence or data presented linking myrtenyl acetate alone to breast cancer inhibition. Therefore, while the essential oil as a mixture shows anti-proliferative activity, no clear relationship between myrtenyl acetate individually and breast cancer can be established based on this abstract.

myrcene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract reports that the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica contains myrcene as one of its constituents (3.3-3.6%) and that the essential oil exhibits inhibitory activity against breast cancer MCF-7 cells. However, the study does not isolate or specifically attribute the anti-cancer activity to myrcene itself. The anti-proliferative effect is described for the whole essential oil mixture, and further detailed studies are recommended to clarify the anti-cancer activity. Therefore, there is no clear evidence from this abstract that directly links myrcene alone to breast cancer inhibition.

β-pinene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract reports that the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica contains β-pinene as one of its constituents (3.0%) and that the oil exhibits inhibitory activity against breast cancer MCF-7 cells. However, the study evaluates the whole essential oil's effect on breast cancer cells, not the isolated effect of β-pinene specifically. There is no direct evidence or data presented in the abstract linking β-pinene alone to breast cancer inhibition. Therefore, while the essential oil shows anti-breast cancer activity, no clear relationship between β-pinene individually and breast cancer is established.

∆3-carene_breast_cancer.reason: The abstract reports that the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica contains 78 compounds including ∆3-carene at 3.4%. The essential oil showed inhibitory effects on breast cancer MCF-7 cell growth. However, the study does not provide specific evidence linking ∆3-carene individually to breast cancer inhibition. The anti-cancer activity is attributed to the essential oil as a whole, without isolating the effects of ∆3-carene. Therefore, there is no clear evidence of a direct relationship between ∆3-carene and breast cancer based on this abstract.

compound_extraction_reason: The abstract specifically names several chemical compounds identified in the essential oil of Juniperus sibirica needles, including α-pinene, limonene, phellandrene, myrtenyl acetate, myrcene, β-pinene, and ∆3-carene. These are specific volatile organic compounds characterized as major constituents of the essential oil, thus meeting the criteria for specific chemical compound names.
